thread.title: NFL monitoring Hurricane Joaquin, expects Eagles-Redskins to kick off on schedule
thread.title_full: NFL monitoring Hurricane Joaquin, expects Eagles-Redskins to kick off on schedule

title: NFL monitoring Hurricane Joaquin, expects Eagles-Redskins to kick off on schedule
text:
NFL monitoring Hurricane Joaquin, expects Eagles-Redskins to kick off on schedule League plans to stick with 1 p.m. ET kickoff for Eagles-Redskins in Maryland. Post to Facebook NFL monitoring Hurricane Joaquin, expects Eagles-Redskins to kick off on schedule League plans to stick with 1 p.m. ET kickoff for Eagles-Redskins in Maryland. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1Rl1gao Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs NFL monitoring Hurricane Joaquin, expects Eagles-Redskins to kick off on schedule USA TODAY Sports 4:31 p.m. EDT October 2, 2015 Redskins QB Kirk Cousins should be playing at 1 p.m. ET Sunday despite the threat of weather. (Photo: Eric Hartline, USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
It appears the East Coast will be spared the full fury of Hurricane Joaquin. 
The NFL plans on moving forward with Sunday's scheduled 1 p.m. ET kickoff for the Washington Redskins and Philadelphia Eagles in Landover, Md., but will continue to monitor weather reports closely. USA TODAY Sports' Week 4 NFL picks 
The league released the following statement Friday: "Our primary concern as it relates to Hurricane Joaquin is the safety of the public, including our fans and clubs. Based on the storm’s current trajectory and the lifting by Governor Hogan of the state of emergency in eight Maryland counties, including Montgomery and Prince George’s County (where FedEx Field is located), we expect to play Sunday’s Philadelphia at Washington game as scheduled on Sunday at 1 p.m. ET. The governor’s office has assured us that based on the current forecast playing the game would have no adverse effect on public safety. We will continue to monitor the storm, stay in contact with the governor’s office and other public authorities, and be prepared to adjust the schedule if necessary should the forecast change. " 
PHOTOS: Week 4 games ranked by watchability Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 15. Raiders at Bears: Beyond checking in on Amari Cooper's progress, it's difficult to find a reason to watch this game. USA TODAY Sports 14. Browns at Chargers: Things are looking bleak in both Cleveland and San Diego after 1-2 starts. USA TODAY Sports 13. Jaguars at Colts: The Colts might not be out of their funk just yet, but the Jaguars will be hard-pressed to leave Indianapolis with a win. USA TODAY Sports 12. Texans at Falcons: Julio Jones is off to a record start for the Falcons, but the Texans throw the ball more than any other team. USA TODAY Sports 11. Panthers at Buccaneers: Quarterback showdowns don't get much better than the one we'll see Sunday between these two gunslingers. USA TODAY Sports 10. Giants at Bills: New York is coming off extra rest after last Thursday's win, but Buffalo is riding high following its win over Miami. USA TODAY Sports 9. Eagles at Redskins: Are the Eagles really fixed? Chip Kelly and Co. can get to .500 in this NFC East showdown. USA TODAY Sports 8. Rams at Cardinals: Carson Palmer hasn't been touched much this season, but he hasn't faced a defensive line like the Rams' front. USA TODAY Sports 7. Packers at 49ers: Aaron Rodgers and the Packers could make things ugly for a 49ers team that struggled to stop the Cardinals. USA TODAY Sports 6. Cowboys at Saints: Brandon Weeden and Luke McCown don't exactly scream prime-time matchup, but Sunday night's game has potential nonetheless. USA TODAY Sports 5. Ravens at Steelers: Thursday night's matchup gets a bit of a twist with Ben Roethlisberger sidelined. USA TODAY Sports 4. Chiefs at Bengals: The Chiefs' fearsome pass rush looks to rattle Andy Dalton and the 3-0 Bengals. USA TODAY Sports 3. Lions at Seahawks: Former Seahawks wide receiver Golden Tate will be looking for revenge against his former teammates. USA TODAY Sports 2. Jets at Dolphins: Make sure to get up early Sunday to catch this AFC East matchup in London. USA TODAY Sports 1. Vikings at Broncos: Denver's top-ranked defense faces another big test in Adrian Peterson. USA TODAY Sports Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
